    • Accessing PLAY Project Data

    Accessing PLAY Project Data

    Rick O. Gilmore

    2023-06-05

    PLAYdata-vignette.Rmd

    Vignette Info

    The Play & Learning Across a Year (PLAY) Project is a research project that collects and shares video recordings and other data from a one-hour natural home interaction between 12-, 18-, and 24-month-old infants and their mothers.

    This package facilitates use of and interaction with the data collected on PLAY, especially the survey data. These data are stored in the Databrary data library, hosted at New York University. Some data are available to the public, but most of the data are restricted to researchers who have secured authorization from their home institutions.

    Registering for Databrary access

    If you are already an authorized investigator with access to Databrary, you may skip to the next section.

    If you are not an authorized investigator, you must register and secure authorization from an institution. The authorization process requires formal agreement by an institution. But you’ll create an account ID (email) and secure password when you register. Then, when you log in with your new credentials, you’ll select an existing institution (if yours is on the list), a new institution (if yours isn’t), or an existing authorized investigator (if you are a student, postdoc, or collaborator) to request authorization from.
